alert.note: Alert for Clay (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 8:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Clay. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 853 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Manchester, Boho, Goose Rock, Botto, Plank, Hector, Lipps, Bluehole, Horse Creek Junction, Littleton, House, Hima, Brightshade, Sibert, Herron, Ice Cliff, Bernice, Pigeonroost, Marcum and Creekville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
